definition: to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
numerous/confused/disorderly
to fly
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
pinyin: feng1 yan1 si4 qi3 , zhan4 huo3 fen1 fei1

sentences.english: On a snow coverd winter day, you gave birth to your first child.
sentences.chinese: 在冬季大雪紛飛的一天，您生下了第一個孩子。

sentences.english: Walk on the streets, the fallen petal flutters lost time not to recover.
sentences.chinese: 走在落花紛飛的街道，逝去的時光無法再挽回。

sentences.english: Will not make any people see wars in the world.
sentences.chinese: 不讓人們看見戰火紛飛的世界。

sentences.english: Walking along the stairway, walking through lane, standing on the bridge, thinking about everything.
sentences.chinese: 漫步石徑，穿梭小巷，佇立橋頭，思緒紛飛。

sentences.english: Tiny splinters fly as the workman planes the wood smooth.
sentences.chinese: 隨着工人將木頭打磨光滑，木屑紛飛。

sentences.english: This is a yellow leaves falling in season, look up, full Shuqing chung.
sentences.chinese: 本該是個黃葉紛飛的季節，仰頭，滿樹青舂。

sentences.english: Snow outside the window, my heart is scorching.
sentences.chinese: 窗外雪花紛飛，我心驕陽似火。

sentences.english: Vladimir Radmanovic was born into civil war in the former Yugoslavia.
sentences.chinese: 拉馬出生在南斯拉夫戰火紛飛的年代。

sentences.english: The paper under the umbrella of the affair, falling in the falling rain.
sentences.chinese: 那油紙傘下的情愫，飄落在紛飛的細雨之中。

sentences.english: There are jungles and military clashes. She is the only Chinese woman there.
sentences.chinese: 那塊土地戰火紛飛，她是唯一的中國女性。

sentences.english: This autumn we can look forward to falling leaves and rising gas prices.
sentences.chinese: 秋天，我們可以期待紛飛的落葉和暴漲的油價。

sentences.english: The New Year came in with heavy snow storms.
sentences.chinese: 在大雪紛飛中新年來到了。

sentences.english: After graduating from university, classmates leave for various directions.
sentences.chinese: 自大學畢業後，同學們勞燕紛飛。

sentences.english: Autumn, it is a season of falling leaves.
sentences.chinese: 秋來了，又是一個落葉紛飛的季節。

sentences.english: July fiercely, sky filled by the rain.
sentences.chinese: 七月的雨紛飛，漫天遍野。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
wind-borne/tossed about by the wind
(literary) to weep in silence
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
in the wind/facing the wind/downwind
brightly colored/unaffected (i.e. behaving naturally)
to chat with a low voice
pipedream/unrealizable plan
the tip of a tree/treetop
dead leaves/to lose leaves (of plants)/deciduous
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
dead leaf/withered leaf
